org.tantalum.storage

Class StaticCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tantalum.storage.StaticCache
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    StaticWebCache

    public class StaticCache
extends java.lang.Object
    A cache which returns Objects based on a String key asynchronously from RAM, RMS, or network and synchronously from RAM and RMS. Objects in RAM are kept with WeakReferences so they may be garbage collected. Objects in flash memory are managed in a "least recently accessed" form to garbage collect and make space when persistent storage runs low. Each StaticCache uses a single RMS and may be referred to by name. You may provide alternative MODEs to change the default characteristics of a given StaticCache.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  StaticCache.GetLocalTask
      A helper class to get data asynchronously from the local cache without attempting to get data from the web.

      Total size of the cache as it exists in flash memory.

    • Field Detail

      • cache

        protected final WeakHashCache cache
        A heap memory cache in the form of a Hashtable from which data can be removed automatically by the virtual machine to free up memory (automatic memory management).

      • accessOrder

        protected final LRUVector accessOrder
        The order in which object in the cache have been accessed since the program started. Each time an object is accessed, it moves to the beginning of the last. Least recently used objects are the ones most likely to be cleared when additional flash memory is needed. The heap memory WeakReferenceCache does not make use of this access order.

      • priority

        protected final char priority
        This character serves as a market tag to distinguish the contents of this cache from other caches which may also be stored in flash memory in a flat name space. This must be unique like '0'..'9' or 'a'..'z'. Larger character values indicate lower priority caches which will be garage collected first when flash memory is low, so use larger characters for more transient or less-important-to-persist data.

      • handler

        protected final DataTypeHandler handler
        This interface gives one method you must provide to convert from the raw byte[] format received from a web server or similar source into an Object format such as Image or your own data model. This is usually a parser of some kind. It will be run both when data first arrives over the network, and again any time the data is loaded from flash memory. Since the heap memory cache uses WeakReference, values may be loaded from flash memory several times. This conversion method should therefore be stateless and thread safe so it can be run on several threads and possibly multiple cores at the same time.

      • sizeAsBytes

        protected int sizeAsBytes
        Total size of the cache as it exists in flash memory. This is often larger than the current heap cache memory consumption.

      • StaticCache

        public StaticCache(char priority,
           DataTypeHandler handler)
        Create a named cache Caches with higher priority are more likely to keep their data when space is limited.
        Parameters:
        priority - - a character from '0' to '9', higher numbers get a preference for space
        handler -

      • setFlashCacheDisabled

        public void setFlashCacheDisabled(boolean disabled)
        Turn of persistent local storage use for read and write to see what happens to the application performance. This is most useful for StaticWebCache but may be useful in other test cases.
        Parameters:
        disabled -

      • synchronousGet

        protected java.lang.Object synchronousGet(java.lang.String key)
                                   throws FlashDatabaseException
        Get the value from local RAM or Flash cache memory. null is returned if the value is not available locally.
        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        FlashDatabaseException

      • putAsync

        public java.lang.Object putAsync(java.lang.String key,
                        byte[] bytes)
        Store a value to heap and flash memory. Note that the storage to RMS is done asynchronously in the background which may lead to large binary objects being queued up on the Worker thread. If you do this many times, you could run short on memory, and should re-factor with use of synchronousPutToRMS() instead. Note that conversion to use form happens immediately and synchronously on the calling thread before before this method returns. If conversion may take a long time (XML parsing, etc) then consider not calling this from the user event dispatch thread.
        Parameters:
        key -
        bytes -
        Returns:
        the byte[] converted to use form by the cache's Handler

      • remove

        protected void remove(java.lang.String key)
        Note that delete is synchronous, so while this operation does not take long, other operations using the RMS may cause a slight stagger or pause before this operation can complete.
        Parameters:
        key -
